alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:34AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CRAWFORD...NORTHWESTERN SEBASTIAN AND NORTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH COUNTIES... At 434 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southeast of Short, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Cedarville... Alma... Lavaca... Mulberry... Dyer... Rudy... Figure Five... Short... Kibler... Concord... Shibley... Uniontown... Dora... Furry... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 21. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 327 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 27. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
